contentrichtext.text: [[File:Leizhou peninsula.jpg|thumb|The Qiongzhou Strait]] The '''Qiongzhou Strait''' ({{zh|s=琼州海峡|t=瓊州海峽|p=Qióngzhōu Hǎixiá}}), also called the '''Hainan Strait''', is a body of water that separates the [[Leizhou Peninsula]] in [[Guangdong]], southern [[China]], to the north from [[Hainan|Hainan Island]] to its south. The [[strait]] connects the [[Gulf of Tonkin]] in the west to the [[James Shoal]] on the eastern edge of the [[South China Sea]]. [[File:Qiongzhou Strait - 01.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Qiongzhou Strait with [[Leizhou Peninsula]] in background viewed from [[Haikou City]], Hainan, China.]] The strait is on average {{Convert|30|km|abbr=on}} wide<ref name="Sohu">{{Cite web|url=http://news.sohu.com/20100109/n269469867.shtml|title=China to bridge the Qiongzhou Strait at a cost of 140 Billion RMB (我国将在琼州海峡建首座跨海大桥 投资超1400亿)|language=Chinese|publisher=[[Sohu]]|date=September 1, 2010|accessdate=January 10, 2011}}</ref> and centered at {{Coord|20|09|N|110|16|E|}} with a maximum water depth of approximately {{Convert|120|m|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{Cite web|url=|url=http://fvcom.smast.umassd.edu/publications/shi.pdf|title=The Role of Qiongzhou Strait in the Seasonal Variation of the South China Sea Circulation|date=January 2002|accessdate=January 10, 2011}}</ref> The [[Guangdong–Hainan Ferry]] carries rail cars and automotive vehicles across the strait. A 140 billion [[Chinese yuan|RMB]] ($21 billion [[USD]]) bridge across the strait is planned to begin construction in 2012.<ref name="Sohu" /> The bridge is currently designed to have levels for both trains and cars, and is expected to be {{Convert|26.3|km|abbr=on}} long.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newsgd.com/news/guangdong1/content/2008-12/25/content_4796350.htm|title=GD, Hainan planning cross-Qiongzhou straits bridge|date=December 25, 2008|accessdate=January 10, 2011}}</ref> Currently the strait is susceptible to closure during strong typhoon activity.<ref>{{Cite news |title= Typhoon Chanthu lands on south China |url= http://www.enbar.net/en/2010-07-22/content7_89208.shtml |work= Enbar.net |date= July 22, 2010 |accessdate= August 14, 2010}}</ref> ==See also== * [[Qiongshan District]], formerly called ''Qiongzhou'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *Shi et al., [http://fvcom.smast.umassd.edu/publications/shi.pdf The Role of Qiongzhou Strait in the Seasonal Variation of the South China Sea Circulation] {{Straits of China}} [[Category:Geography of Guangdong]] [[Category:Geography of Hainan]] [[Category:South China Sea]] [[Category:Gulf of Tonkin]] [[Category:Straits of China]] {{Guangdong-geo-stub}}
